title: Jodi Anasta enjoys a day out with her mother and daughter Aleeia
text:
She was forced to take a three-week break from filming Neighbours in June this year due to 'exhaustion'.

But on Sunday, Jodi Anasta didn't seem to have a care in the world as she enjoyed a day out with her mother Bronwyn and daughter Aleeia.

Taking to Instagram, the 34-year-old actress shared a snap alongside her family and captioned the post: 'New exciting adventures.'

'New exciting adventures': Jodi Anasta (centre) enjoyed a day out with her mother Bronwyn and daughter Aleeia on Sunday

The trio appeared to be wearing matching coloured black outfits as they posed and smiled for the camera.

Also visible in the distance is the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge and the blue ocean waters.

Jodi usually spends her weekdays in Melbourne, where Neighbours is filmed and flies into Sydney on weekends to see her daughter.

Family: Jodi usually spends her weekdays in Melbourne, where Neighbours is filmed and flies into Sydney on weekends to see her daughter

The outing comes less than one week after Jodi's ex-husband NRL star Braith Anasta proposed to his girlfriend Rachael Lee.

The couple began dating in 2016 and share daughter Gigi, one, together while Braith has daughter Aleeia, five, with Jodi , and Rachael Lee has older son Addison, eight, from a previous relationship.

Taking to Instagram on Tuesday, Rachael announced her engagement by sharing a short video of Braith's romantic proposal.

Engagement: Jodi's outing comes less than one week after her ex-husband NRL star Braith Anasta (right) proposed to his girlfriend Rachael Lee (left)

In the footage, the couple's three children, Aleeia, Gigi and Addison, wore matching T-shirts which spelled out the phrase, 'Will U marry me?'

The former Canterbury Bulldogs player then stepped forward, took out the ring and asked: 'I love you, bubba. Will you marry me?'

Following their special engagement, the couple enjoyed a meal at a restaurant with family and friends.
description: She was forced to take a three-week break from filming Neighbours in June this year due to 'exhaustion'.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
